question: Portulaca laljii, a new species of wild Sun Rose has been recently discovered in which Indian state?
explanation:
Botanists have discovered a new species of wild Sun Rose named ‘Portulaca laljii’, from the Eastern Ghats in India.
The species has been discovered in Prakasam district of Andhra Pradesh. It is found to have unique features such as tuberous root, no hair in its leaf axils, reddish pink flower among others. Sun Roses are low-growing flowering plants in the rock rose family (Cistaceae).
